alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Marion; Schley; Stewart; Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 8:33AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Marion, Chattahoochee, Stewart, Webster, Schley and western Sumter Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 833 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Charles, or 7 miles northwest of Lumpkin, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Lumpkin, Buena Vista, Ellaville, Preston, Cusseta, Richland, Plains, Fort Moore, Weston, Sumter, Putnam, Brantley, Seminole, Murrays Crossroads, Florence Marina State Park, Westville, Croxton Crossroads, La Crosse and Brooklyn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Chattahoochee; Marion; Schley; Stewart; Sumter; Webster
